name.en: Introduction of Advanced Materials on ICT Applications
name.ch: 高階智慧醫材資通訊應用導論

department.ch: 生醫科學與工程學系生物醫學工程碩士班
department.en: Master Program in Biomedical Engineering, Department of Biomedical Sciences and Engineering

goal.ch: 透過理論教學並結合Wifiboy / ESP32實務操作讓泛生醫工程學生了解高階醫材的於資通訊及人工智慧上的應用。
goal.en: Through theoretical teaching and practical operation of Wifiboy / ESP32, biomedical engineering students can understand the applications of high-end medical materials in information communications and artificial intelligence.

outline.ch:
1. Introduction and Installation:
Overview of MicroPython and the Thonny development environment.
Demonstration of how to install and set up MicroPython in Thonny.
2. Basic Concepts and Control Structures:
Editing and executing scripts in Thonny.
Learning about data types, variables, basic operators, and simple if and loop structures.
3. Functions and Modules:
Creating and calling functions in Thonny.
Exploring common built-in modules.
4. Basic Input/Output and Error Handling:
Performing standard input-output operations in Thonny.
Learning basic exception handling.
5. Integrated Practice and Introduction to ESP32:
Introduction to ESP32 hardware and capabilities.
Deploying simple MicroPython programs to ESP32 through Thonny.
6. Introduction to the ESP-32
WiFiBoy ESP32 Pro Architecture programs to ESP32 through Thonny es and Feature Peripherals
7. Access buttons, basic drawings, and sound generation ＆ Building a MicroPython heart rate monitor
8. Pulse Oximeter with Max30102 and Wifiboy
9. Building a MicroPython ECG monitor
10. DHT-11 Temperature and Humidity Data logger ＆ Building ESP Mesh as IoMT backbone
11. Team Project by using Biosensors and Ad hoc networking (painlessmesh, or ESP-Now ).
12. Wifi/BLE Interactive Control.
13. Problem Definition and Data Collection:
Introduction to Atrial Fibrillation: Exploring the medical significance and technical challenges of atrial fibrillation.
14. Data Preprocessing and Exploration:
Data Preprocessing: Learning to clean and format data using Python tools.
15. Model Architecture Selection and Training:
Hands-On Training: Practical session using TensorFlow or Keras to train neural networks on ECG data.
16. Model Optimization and TFLite Conversion:
Model Optimization Techniques: Learning optimization techniques such as pruning and quantization.
TFLite Model Conversion: Guiding the conversion of trained models into TFLite format.
17. Deployment to ESP32 and Sensor Integration:
Setting up ESP32 Development Environment:
sensors.
18. Performance Testing and Adjustment:
Testing and Evaluation: Testing the accuracy and inference speed of the model on ESP32.
Problem Discussion and Solutions: Discussing potential challenges and strategies for resolution.
outline.en:
1. Introduction and Installation:
Overview of MicroPython and the Thonny development environment.
Demonstration of how to install and set up MicroPython in Thonny.
2. Basic Concepts and Control Structures:
Editing and executing scripts in Thonny.
Learning about data types, variables, basic operators, and simple if and loop structures.
3. Functions and Modules:
Creating and calling functions in Thonny.
Exploring common built-in modules.
4. Basic Input/Output and Error Handling:
Performing standard input-output operations in Thonny.
Learning basic exception handling.
5. Integrated Practice and Introduction to ESP32:
Introduction to ESP32 hardware and capabilities.
Deploying simple MicroPython programs to ESP32 through Thonny.
6. Introduction to the ESP-32
WiFiBoy ESP32 Pro Architecture programs to ESP32 through Thonny es and Feature Peripherals
7. Access buttons, basic drawings, and sound generation ＆ Building a MicroPython heart rate monitor
8. Pulse Oximeter with Max30102 and Wifiboy
9. Building a MicroPython ECG monitor
10. DHT-11 Temperature and Humidity Data logger ＆ Building ESP Mesh as IoMT backbone
11. Team Project by using Biosensors and Ad hoc networking (painlessmesh, or ESP-Now ).
12. Wifi/BLE Interactive Control.
13. Problem Definition and Data Collection:
Introduction to Atrial Fibrillation: Exploring the medical significance and technical challenges of atrial fibrillation.
14. Data Preprocessing and Exploration:
Data Preprocessing: Learning to clean and format data using Python tools.
15. Model Architecture Selection and Training:
Hands-On Training: Practical session using TensorFlow or Keras to train neural networks on ECG data.
16. Model Optimization and TFLite Conversion:
Model Optimization Techniques: Learning optimization techniques such as pruning and quantization.
TFLite Model Conversion: Guiding the conversion of trained models into TFLite format.
17. Deployment to ESP32 and Sensor Integration:
Setting up ESP32 Development Environment:
sensors.
18. Performance Testing and Adjustment:
Testing and Evaluation: Testing the accuracy and inference speed of the model on ESP32.
Problem Discussion and Solutions: Discussing potential challenges and strategies for resolution.

textbook.ch: Challa S.S.R. Kumar, Josef Hormes, and Carola Leuschner. Nanofabrication Towards Biomedical Applications. 2005. Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH ＆ Co. KGaA.
textbook.en: Challa S.S.R. Kumar, Josef Hormes, and Carola Leuschner. Nanofabrication Towards Biomedical Applications. 2005. Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH ＆ Co. KGaA.
